title: Step-by-Step UID Workflow
text: Since uid package provides sample data emulates result read_raw_uid_csv, can use tutorial.
code: file_path <- "path_to_your_data.csv" # this will read and clean names, switch the datetime to proper datetime raw <- read_raw_uid_csv(file_path) head(uid_sample_data) #>              datetime     rfid zone   session_name temperature matrix_name #> 1 2025-01-01 00:00:00 A1B2C3D4    3 sample_session       37.16         MM1 #> 2 2025-01-01 00:00:20 A1B2C3D4    3 sample_session       37.24         MM1 #> 3 2025-01-01 00:00:40 A1B2C3D4    8 sample_session       36.66         MM1 #> 4 2025-01-01 00:01:00 A1B2C3D4    2 sample_session       37.25         MM1 #> 5 2025-01-01 00:01:20 A1B2C3D4    3 sample_session       36.98         MM1 #> 6 2025-01-01 00:01:40 A1B2C3D4    4 sample_session       36.98         MM1

title: Step-by-Step UID Workflow
text: can visualize flagged outliers plot_outliers(). save plots specific locations.
code: # jumps of more than one degree will be counted as outliers flagged <- flag_temperature_outliers(uid_sample_data, threshold = 1) # remove temperature outliers clean <- dplyr::filter(flagged, !outlier_global) plot_outliers(flagged, output_dir = tempdir(), filepath = file_path) # example for flagged ggplot2::ggplot(flagged, ggplot2::aes(datetime, temperature, group=rfid)) +   ggplot2::geom_line() +   ggplot2::geom_point(     data = flagged |> dplyr::filter(outlier_global),     ggplot2::aes(datetime, temperature),     color = "red"   ) +   ggplot2::facet_wrap(~rfid) +   ggplot2::scale_x_datetime(date_breaks = "6 hours", date_labels = "%H:%M")

title: Step-by-Step UID Workflow
Step-by-Step UID Workflow
text: Sample data provided sample interval 20 seconds. can aggregate data precision 1 minute. Data acquisition might generate NAs survive downsampling. included gaps sample data. might desired interpolate NAs using interpolate_gaps(). can set add_flag = TRUE check values interpolated. increasing max_gap parameter, interpolating larger gaps. can visualize results interpolation slicing portion dataset make linear interpolation evident.  interp data frame now holds cleaned, downsampled values short gaps interpolated. processing multiple files automatically, see vignette process_all_uid_files() (help("process_all_uid_files")).
code: down_temp <- downsample_temperature(with_activity, n = 1, precision = "minute") down_act  <- downsample_activity(with_activity, n = 1, precision = "minute") merged <- dplyr::left_join(   down_temp, down_act,   by = c("session_name", "rfid", "common_dt", "matrix_name") ) dplyr::filter(merged, is.na(temperature)) #> # A tibble: 37 × 6 #>    session_name rfid  matrix_name common_dt           temperature activity_index #>    <chr>        <chr> <chr>       <dttm>                    <dbl>          <dbl> #>  1 sample_sess… A1B2… MM1         2025-01-01 03:28:00          NA             NA #>  2 sample_sess… A1B2… MM1         2025-01-01 03:29:00          NA             NA #>  3 sample_sess… A1B2… MM1         2025-01-01 03:30:00          NA             NA #>  4 sample_sess… A1B2… MM1         2025-01-01 17:30:00          NA             NA #>  5 sample_sess… A1B2… MM1         2025-01-01 17:31:00          NA             NA #>  6 sample_sess… A1B2… MM1         2025-01-01 17:32:00          NA             NA #>  7 sample_sess… A1B2… MM1         2025-01-01 17:33:00          NA             NA #>  8 sample_sess… A1B2… MM1         2025-01-01 17:34:00          NA             NA #>  9 sample_sess… A1B2… MM1         2025-01-01 17:35:00          NA             NA #> 10 sample_sess… A1B2… MM1         2025-01-01 17:36:00          NA             NA #> # ℹ 27 more rows interp <- merged |>   dplyr::group_by(rfid, session_name, matrix_name) |>   interpolate_gaps(     max_gap = 10,     target_cols = c("temperature", "activity_index"),     add_flag = TRUE   ) dplyr::filter(interp, .interpolated) |>    dplyr::select(rfid, common_dt, temperature, .interpolated) #> # A tibble: 37 × 4 #>    rfid     common_dt           temperature .interpolated #>    <chr>    <dttm>                    <dbl> <lgl>         #>  1 A1B2C3D4 2025-01-01 03:28:00        37.0 TRUE          #>  2 A1B2C3D4 2025-01-01 03:29:00        37.1 TRUE          #>  3 A1B2C3D4 2025-01-01 03:30:00        37.2 TRUE          #>  4 A1B2C3D4 2025-01-01 17:30:00        37.0 TRUE          #>  5 A1B2C3D4 2025-01-01 17:31:00        37.0 TRUE          #>  6 A1B2C3D4 2025-01-01 17:32:00        37.0 TRUE          #>  7 A1B2C3D4 2025-01-01 17:33:00        37.0 TRUE          #>  8 A1B2C3D4 2025-01-01 17:34:00        37.0 TRUE          #>  9 A1B2C3D4 2025-01-01 17:35:00        37.0 TRUE          #> 10 A1B2C3D4 2025-01-01 17:36:00        37.0 TRUE          #> # ℹ 27 more rows ggplot2::ggplot(interp |> dplyr::slice(200:300, .by = rfid), ggplot2::aes(common_dt, temperature, group=rfid, color = .interpolated)) +   ggplot2::geom_line() +   ggplot2::facet_wrap(~rfid) +   ggplot2::scale_x_datetime(date_breaks = "30 min", date_labels = "%H:%M")+   ggplot2::scale_color_manual(values = c("TRUE" = "red", "FALSE" = "gray20"))

code: @Manual{,   title = {uid: Interface with data coming from [UID matrix Software](https://www.uidevices.com/home-cage-monitoring/)},   author = {Matias Andina},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.2},   url = {https://github.com/matiasandina/uid}, }

what: Interface with data coming from [UID matrix Software](https://www.uidevices.com/home-cage-monitoring/)
title: Interface with data coming from [UID matrix Software](https://www.uidevices.com/home-cage-monitoring/)
text: goal uid streamline processing temperature data exported UID devices. provides functions cleaning, outlier detection, downsampling, diagnostic plotting, assuming structured directory layout raw processed data.

title: Interface with data coming from [UID matrix Software](https://www.uidevices.com/home-cage-monitoring/)
text: can install development version uid like :

title: Interface with data coming from [UID matrix Software](https://www.uidevices.com/home-cage-monitoring/)
text: package assumes following directory layout:
code: temperature/ ├── raw_data/   # Place raw UID .CSV files here └── data/       # Cleaned, downsampled outputs will be written here

title: Interface with data coming from [UID matrix Software](https://www.uidevices.com/home-cage-monitoring/)
text: : Group files shared base name (e.g. handling _1_of_n format) Remove temperature outliers Downsample 1-minute intervals (default) Save cleaned data diagnostic plots can also use lower-level functions custom workflows:
code: library(uid)  # Process all raw UID CSVs from a directory process_all_uid_files(   raw_export_dir = "temperature/raw_data",   output_dir = "temperature/data" ) df <- read_raw_uid_csv("path/to/file.csv") df_flagged <- flag_temperature_outliers(df, threshold = 1) df_clean <- df_flagged |> dplyr::filter(!outlier_global) df_downsampled <- downsample_temperature(df_clean)

title: Interface with data coming from [UID matrix Software](https://www.uidevices.com/home-cage-monitoring/)
text: Planned features include: Example Data & Tests Docs Feature extraction function Package Logo :)

what: Calculate Activity Index Based on Zone Transitions — calculate_activity
title: Calculate Activity Index Based on Zone Transitions — calculate_activity
text: Computes theoretical distance traveled sequential zone visits using UID Mouse Matrix coordinates. Adds new column activity_index data frame.

title: Calculate Activity Index Based on Zone Transitions — calculate_activity
Calculate Activity Index Based on Zone Transitions — calculate_activity
text: df data frame columns rfid, datetime, zone

title: Calculate Activity Index Based on Zone Transitions — calculate_activity
text: input data frame added activity_index column (inches).

what: Check for Existing Output Files and Prompt Overwrite Options — check_overwrite_permissions
title: Check for Existing Output Files and Prompt Overwrite Options — check_overwrite_permissions
text: Given set group names output directory, function checks expected output files already exist. , prompts user decide whether overwrite, skip, abort.

title: Check for Existing Output Files and Prompt Overwrite Options — check_overwrite_permissions
Check for Existing Output Files and Prompt Overwrite Options — check_overwrite_permissions
text: output_dir Path directory output files written. group_names character vector file group base names.

title: Check for Existing Output Files and Prompt Overwrite Options — check_overwrite_permissions
text: character vector group names processed. excludes user chose skip.

what: Wrapper to clean UID temperature CSV: read, flag outliers, downsample, and plot — clean_raw_uid

text: Wrapper clean UID temperature CSV: read, flag outliers, downsample, plot

title: Wrapper to clean UID temperature CSV: read, flag outliers, downsample, and plot — clean_raw_uid
code: clean_raw_uid(   filepath,   n = 1,   precision = "minute",   outlier_threshold_celsius = 1,   output_dir = "temperature/data",   plot = TRUE )

title: Wrapper to clean UID temperature CSV: read, flag outliers, downsample, and plot — clean_raw_uid
text: filepath Path raw UID CSV. n Downsampling interval size (default = 1) applied temperature activity data. precision Time unit downsampling (default = "minute"). outlier_threshold_celsius Temperature difference threshold flag outliers. output_dir Directory save diagnostic plots. plot boolean indicate whether plot process outlier removal downsampling

title: Wrapper to clean UID temperature CSV: read, flag outliers, downsample, and plot — clean_raw_uid
text: Cleaned, downsampled data frame.

text: Downsample activity index data fixed intervals

title: Downsample activity index data to fixed intervals — downsample_activity
Downsample activity index data to fixed intervals — downsample_activity
text: df cleaned dataframe datetime, rfid, session_name, matrix_name, activity_index. n Number time units per bin (default = 1). precision Time unit binning (e.g., "minute").

title: Downsample activity index data to fixed intervals — downsample_activity
text: Downsampled data frame activity index summarized median. Missing data time bins filled NA.

title: Downsample temperature data to fixed intervals — downsample_temperature
text: Downsampled data frame temperature summarized median. Missing data time bins filled NA.

title: Estimate Sampling Interval from Grouped Data — estimate_sampling_interval

title: Flag temperature outliers based on rolling difference threshold — flag_temperature_outliers
Flag temperature outliers based on rolling difference threshold — flag_temperature_outliers
text: df dataframe datetime, rfid, temperature. threshold Maximum allowed temperature jump (default = 1).

title: Flag temperature outliers based on rolling difference threshold — flag_temperature_outliers
text: Data frame added temp_diff outlier_global columns.

what: Interpolate Short Gaps in UID Time Series Data — interpolate_gaps
title: Interpolate Short Gaps in UID Time Series Data — interpolate_gaps
text: Fills small gaps (NAs) downsampled UID data using linear interpolation, gaps longer specified number bins. Assumes regular time step (e.g., 1-minute bins) operates within grouping variables like rfid session_name.

title: Interpolate Short Gaps in UID Time Series Data — interpolate_gaps
code: interpolate_gaps(   df,   max_gap = 10,   target_cols = c("temperature", "activity_index"),   add_flag = FALSE )

title: Interpolate Short Gaps in UID Time Series Data — interpolate_gaps
text: df downsampled data frame, ideally grouped one identifiers. max_gap Maximum number consecutive missing bins interpolate (default = 10). target_cols Character vector column names interpolate. add_flag Logical. TRUE, adds .interpolated column (default = FALSE).

title: Interpolate Short Gaps in UID Time Series Data — interpolate_gaps
text: data frame interpolated values short gaps.

what: Plot and save downsampled temperature trace — plot_downsampled_temperature
title: Plot and save downsampled temperature trace — plot_downsampled_temperature
text: Generates line plot downsampled temperature common_dt, faceted rfid, writes output_dir/clean_plots/<basename>_downsampled.png.

title: Plot and save downsampled temperature trace — plot_downsampled_temperature
Plot and save downsampled temperature trace — plot_downsampled_temperature
text: df_down Data frame returned downsample(). Must contain common_dt, temperature, rfid. output_dir Directory clean_plots/ created (needed). filepath Original CSV path—used derive base filename saving.

title: Plot and save downsampled temperature trace — plot_downsampled_temperature
text: Invisibly returns ggplot object.

what: Plot and save outlier diagnostic — plot_outliers
title: Plot and save outlier diagnostic — plot_outliers
text: Creates line plot temperature time, highlighting outliers red, writes output_dir/clean_plots/<basename>_outliers.png.

title: Plot and save outlier diagnostic — plot_outliers
Plot and save outlier diagnostic — plot_outliers
text: df_flagged Data frame returned flag_outliers(), must include columns datetime, temperature, rfid, outlier. output_dir Path root output directory plots. filepath Original data file path used derive base filename.

title: Plot and save outlier diagnostic — plot_outliers
text: Invisibly returns ggplot object.

what: Process All UID CSV Files in Batch — process_all_uid_files
title: Process All UID CSV Files in Batch — process_all_uid_files
text: Finds, groups, processes raw UID export CSVs directory, saves cleaned downsampled outputs target directory.

title: Process All UID CSV Files in Batch — process_all_uid_files
code: process_all_uid_files(   raw_export_dir = "temperature/raw_data",   output_dir = "temperature/data",   n = 1,   precision = "minute",   outlier_threshold = 1 )

title: Process All UID CSV Files in Batch — process_all_uid_files
text: raw_export_dir Directory containing raw UID .CSV files. output_dir Directory write cleaned files . n Bin size downsampling (default = 1). precision Time unit binning (default = \"minute\"). outlier_threshold Temperature delta threshold outlier detection.

title: Process All UID CSV Files in Batch — process_all_uid_files
text: Invisibly returns list output file paths.

what: Quantify bouts of temperature above or below a threshold — quantify_temp_bouts
title: Quantify bouts of temperature above or below a threshold — quantify_temp_bouts
text: Quantify bouts temperature threshold

title: Quantify bouts of temperature above or below a threshold — quantify_temp_bouts
code: quantify_temp_bouts(   df,   threshold,   sampling_interval = estimate_sampling_interval,   direction = "below",   greedy = FALSE,   max_gap = 10 )

title: Quantify bouts of temperature above or below a threshold — quantify_temp_bouts
text: df data frame least columns: rfid, common_dt, variable, value threshold Numeric threshold compare temperature values sampling_interval numeric value representing sampling interval minutes groups. Defaults automatic estimation using estimate_sampling_interval(). direction Either "" "" greedy Logical. TRUE, allow bouts continue NAs. Default FALSE. max_gap Numeric. Maximum number consecutive NA values allowed within bout. Note: bouts still broken non-NA values fail threshold condition.

title: Quantify bouts of temperature above or below a threshold — quantify_temp_bouts
text: data frame one row per bout per animal, start/end/duration

what: Read and clean raw UID CSV file — read_raw_uid_csv
title: Read and clean raw UID CSV file — read_raw_uid_csv
text: Reads UID-formatted CSV, cleans column names, parses datetime.

title: Read and clean raw UID CSV file — read_raw_uid_csv
Read and clean raw UID CSV file — read_raw_uid_csv
text: filepath Path raw CSV file. dt_format Sting defining format time string datetime conversion (e.g,. default "%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S")

title: Read and clean raw UID CSV file — read_raw_uid_csv
text: cleaned data frame datetime column.

title: Example UID Sample Data — uid_sample_data
text: dataset contains 24 hours simulated temperature zone data three RFID-tagged animals. Temperatures include noise realistic artifacts dropped spurious values. Zone entries randomly generated.

title: Example UID Sample Data — uid_sample_data
Example UID Sample Data — uid_sample_data
text: data frame N rows 6 columns: datetime Timestamp POSIXct format rfid Unique identifier subject zone Integer 1 8 session_name Session identifier (character) temperature Body temperature artifacts matrix_name Group label

title: Example UID Sample Data — uid_sample_data
text: Simulated data testing uid functionality.

title: uid 0.1.2
text: Adding column validation reading raw data Adding sampling data uid_sample_data Adding vignette basic processing (step--step).

title: uid 0.1.1
text: Adding helper function estimate sampling rate (uid:::estimate_sampling_interval()) Adding tests helper function Allowing sampling rate estimated data passed via parameter removing run_id bout quantification output Fixing typos Updating README.md

title: uid 0.1.0
text: Initial Github submission. Adding basic function read, write, process Adding basic linear gap interpolation Adding basic activity metrics Including gap filling duration processing
